intro: Sebastiania warmingii, commonly known as the red-seed tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of Central and South America, particularly in regions with tropical climates. The plant is characterized by its smooth, grayish bark and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its bright red, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. Sebastiania warmingii is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
